#summary How to use Jetlang in your Maven-based project
#labels Featured

To use Jetlang in your Maven-based project, it will be necessary to add our repository to your pom file. (Or if you use a repository manager, such as [http://nexus.sonatype.org/ Nexus], you can have it mirror our repository)

Add the following segment to your pom:

{{{
<project>
    ...
    <repositories>
        <repository>
            <id>jetlang.googlecode.com</id>
            <name>Jetlang Repository for Maven</name>
            <url>http://jetlang.googlecode.com/svn/repo/</url>
        </repository>
    </repositories>
    ...
</project>
}}}

Now, to use Jetlang, add the following dependency. Replace _DESIRED_VERSION_HERE_ with the version you would like to use.

{{{
<project>
    ...
    <dependencies>
        ...
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.jetlang</groupId>
            <artifactId>jetlang</artifactId>
            <version>_DESIRED_VERSION_HERE_</version>
        </dependency>
        ...
    </dependencies>
    ...
</project>
}}}
